title: SQL ServerGETDATE()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerGETDATE()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the current database system date and time:
SELECT 
  GETDATE();

Definition and Usage
The GETDATE() function returns the current database system date and time, in a 
'YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.mmm' format.
Tip:
Also look at the
CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
function.
Syntax
GETDATE()
Technical Details
Return type:
datetime
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerGETDATE()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerGETDATE()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerGETDATE()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
